alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 10 at 3:06AM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TONIGHT AND MONDAY... .Rain will transition to heavy wet snow after midnight tonight and continue through much of Monday. Snowfall rates of between 1-2"/hr are possible during the Monday morning commute, making travel very difficult. Power outages are possible due to the expected heavy nature of the snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and sleet expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 8 inches and sleet accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Grafton and Southern Coos Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Heavy wet snow will cause weighted tree limbs of conifers and leafed trees, leading to snapped branches. Power outages are possible. Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
